name: Cucumber-Ricotta Sandwiches
description: Part sandwich, part salad, this is an extremely refreshing and satisfying meal. It’s very simple, but there are two requirements: freshly baked bread, with a crisp crust and tender crumb, and the best ricotta you can find, preferably basket ricotta. Skip the low-fat supermarket type: Instead, make your own or use natural cream cheese or queso fresco.
recipeCategory: dinner, lunch, quick, weekday, weeknight, sandwiches, appetizer, main course
keywords: ciabatta bread, cucumber, ricotta, spring, summer, vegetarian
recipeIngredient: 1 serrano chile, very thinly sliced (or minced, with seeds, if preferred)
1 to 2 cups soft, rich ricotta, drained
2 ciabatta rolls, split lengthwise, lightly toasted (or a baguette split lengthwise)
Calendula or other edible flower, for garnish (optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Put cucumbers in a bowl and season with salt and pepper, then toss. Add chile, basil, lime juice, dill, tarragon, mint and chives. Toss well.
Spread ricotta generously over each ciabatta toast. Spoon cucumber mixture over ricotta on each toast. Garnish with cilantro springs and calendula petals, if using.
